item.title: Currency round-up
item.description: New notes for Paraguay, printing error for Thailand, and news from Peru, Costa Rica and Tonga

item.title: King Charles to appear on Bank of England notes from 2024
item.description: Other Commonwealth central banks have made little comment on changeover

item.title: Irish central bank will still exchange old banknotes and coins
item.description: Authorities take opportunity to remind public that UK paper £20s and £50s are expiring

item.title: Banknotes round-up: Egypt debuts polymer note
item.description: Peru continues rollout of new series; Mexico to withdraw 20 peso note; and more

item.title: Kenyan governor denies shortage of small-denomination notes
item.description: Interior minister had claimed that politicians were draining supply to pay election bribes

item.title: Uzbekistan introduces new 200,000 som note
item.description: Highest denomination banknote designed to ease cash payments

item.title: Cash, not trash: the second lives of substrate
item.description: Central banks and their banknote providers are taking a range of approaches to recycling cash

item.title: Honduran banknote to honour murdered activist
item.description: Berta Cáceres, who was killed in 2016, has been declared a “national hero”

item.title: Fiji launches $7 varnished banknote
item.description: Reserve Bank issues commemorative note to celebrate rugby sevens squads

item.title: Are central banks ahead of banknote counterfeiters?
item.description: Antti Heinonen analyses data on recent trends in counterfeiting

item.title: Barbados to make switch to polymer
item.description: Redesigned banknotes will circulate by end of year, says governor

item.title: Liberian central bank publicly burns outdated currency
item.description: Move aims to rebuild public trust after long-running “missing banknote” controversy

item.title: How Afghanistan’s central bank can help prevent famine
item.description: Rules could be devised to allow the New York Fed to ease the acute US dollar banknotes shortage, writes Warren Coats

item.title: Currency Benchmarks 2021 – presentation
item.description: Central Banking’s currency subject matter specialist Rachael King speaks with Chris Jeffery about circulation, impact of Covid-19, forecasting, costs and resourcing, security and design, sustainability, and more

item.title: Ecuador brings in anti-theft dyes
item.description: Latin American country faces increasing crime rates including attacks on ATMs

item.title: Inside the Bank of Israel’s emergency cash supply exercises
item.description: Amir Safranovich and Meir Bitton describe how the central bank ensures the financial system is always ready in case of an emergency

item.title: RBNZ seeks to quell ‘urban myth’ over counterfeit cash
item.description: Central bank says people risk falling foul of the law as practice of “scraping” banknotes spreads

item.title: BSP inks deal with Australian firm for polymer note
item.description: Note Printing Australia will produce 1000-peso banknote, circulating from next year

item.title: Cash: important for a fairer economy
item.description: One interesting economic story over the past year has been the growth in grassroots support for cash payments. Against the backdrop of the Covid‑19 pandemic and now debunked rumours that coins and banknotes could be significant transmission vectors for the virus, it may seem surprising that public support for cash is growing more vocal

item.title: ECB to choose new euro banknote designs by 2024
item.description: Banknote designs will be chosen by governing council, but public input will be vital

item.title: Australia’s central bank to review banknote distribution model
item.description: Decline in transactional cash usage has led to excess capacity

item.title: North Korea issues coupons instead of cash
item.description: Experts say closing of Chinese border due to Covid-19 may have halted banknote production

item.title: Uganda’s central bank cuts banknote printing costs
item.description: Improved processing and new reissuance guidelines streamline banknote management, report says

item.title: Covid-19 has accelerated paradoxical developments in cash usage
item.description: Antti Heinonen explores the unusual patterns in banknote demand in 2020 and draws lessons for the future

item.title: BoE urges public to spend remaining paper banknotes
item.description: Paper £20 and £50 will cease to be legal tender next year

item.title: BoJ unveils new 10,000-yen note
item.description: New banknote features “father of Japanese capitalism” and is set for issue in 2024

item.title: IMF urges Bank of Sierra Leone to investigate cash shortages
item.description: Recent banknote shipment failed to alleviate shortage, fund says

item.title: BoE completes transition to polymer
item.description: New £50 banknote featuring scientist Alan Turing enters circulation

item.title: Malawi picks G+D for currency processing contract
item.description: German-based firm already provides processing services to the Federal Reserve

item.title: Are we entering the polymer age?
item.description: CCL Secure explores the security and anti-counterfeit benefits of polymer banknote technology. As this developing technology reveals its advantages over traditional paper-based banknotes, could we soon see a shift in the status quo in polymer’s favour?

item.title: Cash infrastructure as public good – implications for the cash cycle
item.description: Efforts are under way in the Eurosystem to safeguard cash infrastructure as a ‘public good’ even as transaction volumes have fallen significantly. How can policy-makers strike the right balance?

item.title: Mexican 100-peso note wins international award
item.description: Banknote depicting seventeeth-century nun and poet wins International Bank Note Society accolade

item.title: Future of cash: what we can learn from the history of money
item.description: Central banks must take a broad view of efficiency if they are to preserve the benefits of cash, says Antti Heinonen

item.title: Venezuela releases three new banknotes amid hyperinflation
item.description: High-denomination notes reflect ongoing surge in prices

item.title: Cash in circulation to remain elevated, Bank of Canada research says
item.description: Withdrawal and deposit relationships and high denominations to blame

item.title: Irish central bank to gain stronger anti-counterfeiting powers
item.description: Draft law makes Irish central bank national currency analysis centre and gives it enforcement role

item.title: Syrian central bank issues new banknote
item.description: New 5,000 lira note is issued as expert estimates that war-torn country’s inflation has reached 179%

item.title: ECB reports historically low counterfeit volumes
item.description: €20 and €50 remain the most counterfeited, central bank data shows

item.title: MAS urges Singaporeans to use digital ‘red envelopes’ during Lunar New Year
item.description: E-hong bao help reduce the carbon emissions of printing banknotes, MAS says

item.title: Australian Senate axes plans to ban cash usage above $10,000
item.description: Controversial bill threatened to jail those conducting large cash transactions

item.title: Singapore’s central bank discontinues issuance of $1,000 banknote
item.description: Highest denomination will remain legal tender, but new issuance will cease at the end of 2020

item.title: BoE extends contract with De La Rue
item.description: UK printer will help central bank continue to develop printing site as world leader

item.title: New polymer banknotes are greener and cheaper – T&T governor
item.description: Central bank plans to review coin denomination usage later this year, Alvin Hilaire says

item.title: Kenya’s central bank opens new currency centre
item.description: New facility will improve currency circulation within the region, president Kenyatta says

item.title: Covid-19 may survive 28 days on banknotes and payment cards
item.description: New research suggests virus can survive for an extended period of time at room temperature

item.title: Sama launches polymer version of five-riyal banknote
item.description: New note will circulate alongside existing cotton banknotes

item.title: Global banknote developments before and after Covid-19
item.description: Antti Heinonen looks at how the pandemic triggered sharp changes in demand for cash

item.title: Brazil launches new 200 real banknote as hoarding continues
item.description: New banknote worth $37 features new security features, and has been sized to ensure quick dispersal

item.title: Liberia puts central bank board members on trial
item.description: Former governor and board members are latest to face charges over allegedly missing banknotes

item.title: Fed picks G+D to develop ‘next-generation’ currency processing
item.description: German firm developed new prototype for the Fed to maximise speed and accuracy
